New Records: Adam Banda earned his first MLB win.
Will Smith hit his 20th home run of the season.
Key Match Events: Will Smith's two-run home run in the 7th inning proved decisive.
Shohei Ohtani doubled with a run-scoring error and a sacrifice fly by AJ Polyp scored another run in the 7th inning.
Alex Pages launched a two-run home run in the 8th inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Padres entered the game with a 91-68 record, while the Dodgers were 95-64.
The game was anticipated as a crucial match-up for both teams in their playoff push.
Post-Match Reflections: Will Smith expressed frustration with the slow start but credited the team's resilience.
Joc Pederson highlighted the importance of the win in their playoff race.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Dodger Stadium with a crowd of 52,433 fans in attendance.
The game's score was tied 2-2 until the 7th inning.
The Padres' pitching struggled, allowing 11 runs on 8 hits.
